wikipedia_page.main: Sir George Francis Hardy  (14 December 1855 – 5 October 1914) was a British actuary, Egyptologist and amateur astronomer. He became a Fellow of the Royal Astronomical Society in 1877 and was President of the Institute of Actuaries from 1908 to 1910.

response: * George Francis Hardy (1855–1914), British actuary and amateur astronomer
*George Francis Hardy, Esq., F.I.A., Chairman, Actuarial Advisory Committee to the National Health Insurance Joint Committee.
